glanceback.title: Glance Back
glanceback.description:
You spend so much time staring at your computer... doesn't your computer deserve a chance to glance back at you?

Glance Back is a chrome extension that acts as a daily photo diary, capturing the moments shared between you and your computer. Once a day, when you open a new tab, Glance Back will unexpectedly take your photo, ask you what youâ€™re thinking about, and save both the photo and written thought to its locally stored archive.

Read more about the project and get the extension here.

bodymovementlanguage.title: Body, Movement, Language: A.I. Sketches with Bill T. Jones

press.title: AICP NEXT Awards Shortlist for Digital Experiences

writing.title: Mixing movement and machine: A behind the scenes look at building A.I. experiments with dance legend Bill T. Jones

bodymovementlanguage.description:
Body, Movement, Language is a collection of experiments made at the intersection of art, technology, identity, and the body that were created during a two-way residency between award-winning choreographer Bill T. Jones and the Google Creative Lab.

All four experiments in the collection were built using PoseNet, a machine learning model running on Tensorflow.js. PoseNet runs in the browser, making it accessible to anyone using a modern Internet browser and a web camera.

Read more about the project on its Experiment page.

pastetodownload.title: Paste to download
pastetodownload.description: Paste to download is a chrome extension that makes it easy to save images copied to your clipboard. It's especially useful to download media embedded in tough to export places like Google Slides.

paintmeinpixels.title: Paint me in pixels so I can dance forever
paintmeinpixels.description:
This series exhibits the output of a computer program written to continually layer a dancer's form on screen, creating a unique portrait of their past movement. While any motion performed in ~real life~ lasts only a moment, by rendering myself in pixels I am able to allow my movement to linger on screen indefinitely.

Shown at CADAF Miami for Art Basel and in Times Square and Lightbox in New York City.
